Description: Lip-ornament made from a curved piece of gourd (found in Af.3050)
Production ethnic group: Made by: Murle ('Jibbe', the term used on the registration slip, is how the Murle are referred to by neighbouring peoples.)
Curator's comments: Petherick locates the Djibba somewhere along the Sobat River or the tributaries running into it from the east, which suggests a location in either the administrative districts of either Upper Nile or Jonglei, or across the border into modern Ethiopia (J. Petherick, 1861, Egypt, the Sudan and Central Africa) - Taken from the Pitt Rivers Museum Southern Sudan database.
